name: Technical Failures
description: A taxonomy of technical failings in AI system training, design, performance and generalization.

children.name: Inadequate Data Sampling
children.description: Data sampling is misconfigured, in terms of resolution, selection, biases,  etc.

children.name: Learning Dataset Noise
children.description: The learning dataset the system is built with contains significant amounts of noise, errors and critical outliers that impact performance.

children.name: Inappropriate Training Content
children.description: The learning dataset the system is built with contains significant amounts of instances that are problematic given the target domain (e.g. conveying biases, violent / adult content, etc.).

children.name: Sensitive Information Leak
children.description: The system utilizes sensitive information, but this information is being accidentally exposed during its deployment and/or distribution.

children.name: Unauthorized Data Access
children.description: The system was built and/or uses data without proper authorization / consent.

children.name: Backup Failure
children.description: Recovery from a failure was not possible due to subsequent failures in falling back to backup countermeasures.

children.name: Adversarial Data
children.description: Cases where the training dataset includes instances having unexpected content, labels or characteristics, willingly / maliciously misconfigured.

children.name: Context Misidentification
children.description: Cases where the learner fails to detect the correct context and produces erroneous predictions as a result.

children.name: Learning Dataset Imbalance
children.description: An AI system is set to learn from a collection of data that does not provide enough instances for all desired predictions (e.g. classes).

children.name: Poor Generalization
children.description: A trained AI system fails to perform well once deployed in the real world, where conditions (e.g. statistical properties of input data due to noise, environment, etc.) are novel and  considerably different from the training environment.

children.name: Concept Drift
children.description: The phenomenon where statistical properties of input data and their relationship to the predicted quantity change with the passage of time.

children.name: Covariate Shift
children.description: The scenario where input data distribution changes between different model application scnenarios (e.g. between training and deployment)

children.name: Tuning Issues
children.description: Failures arise due to model configuration, tuning and case-specific details, rather than core capability / methodology-related limitations.

children.name: Misconfigured Aggregation
children.description: The model's decision arises by considering multiple marginal predictions, the combination of which is skewed (e.g. under/overestimating contribution of a particular component) or otherwise problematic.

children.name: Misconfigured Threshold
children.description: The model's decision threshold is configured to favor a subset of classes, leading in large performance differences in, e.g. precision and recall.

children.name: Overfitting
children.description: The system has adopted an overly complicated solution to fit the training data, capturing noise, outliers and irrelevant input artifacts in its modeling.

children.name: Underfitting
children.description: The learning model uses assumptions under which it cannot capture complexity present in the data and generate accurate predictions.

children.name: Underspecification
children.description: The system lacks fundamental and/or necessary components / functionalities to safely and effectively deal with the real-world task it is assigned to.

children.name: Lack of Capability Control
children.description: The system is allowed to act in the real world with a impact / capability levels far beyond what its requires.

children.name: Misaligned Objective
children.description: Failure outcomes are directly and heavily correlated to the most important task / domain requirements being ignored by the training objective.

children.name: Unsafe Exposure or Access
children.description: The system lacks exposure / access limitations and safeguarding measures; as a result, its outputs become harmful.

children.name: Incomplete Data Attribute Capture
children.description: Information extraction from real-world instances omit attributes that are important to representing the instance and solving the learning problem effectively.

children.name: Ignored Expected Externalities
children.description: A system's canonical application results in unsurprising harmful externalities that were not considered or ignored by the designers and/or owners
children.issues: Perhaps we need a 'non-technical' classification for incidents where the AI system works pretty much as intended

children.name: Information Hazard
children.description: The system includes information / application routes / technologies that will cause harm if used by malicious agents for nefarious goals.
children.issues: Investigate whether a more specific label / hierarchy is adequate, given the incident samples (e.g. fake news).

children.name: Distributional Bias
children.description: A trained model reflects biases that exist in its training data that are not representative to the real world or convey meaning that is context-specific and not generally applicable.

children.name: Lack of Adversarial Robustness
children.description: The scenario where a model is sensitive to small changes to input data causing large, undesirable changes in its output.

children.name: Lack of Transparency
children.description: The system converts input data into outputs without clearly exposing internal computational steps and procedures to outside observers.

children.name: Lack of Explainability
children.description: The system converts input data into outputs without its internal workings being explainable to users or even experts.
